titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Francis William Bourdillon Collection
titlestmt.author: by Diane J. Ducharme and Olivia Hillmer

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday January 22, 2019 at 06:50

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The collection consists almost entirely of printed copies of works by Francis William Bourdillon, especially his narrative poems and occasional verse, along with several versions of his translation of Aucassin et Nicolette. In addition, there are sketchbooks, etchings, and a photograph album containing views of the Swiss Alps.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from John Hart on the Hazel M. Osborn Fund, 2002.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Francis William Bourdillon Collection is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Francis William Bourdillon Collection. James Marshall and Marie-Louise Osborn Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The collection received preliminary processing at the time of acquisition.

Information included in the Description of Papers note and Collection Contents section is drawn from the detailed list supplied by the dealer, John Hart, a copy of which is in Box 1, folder 1. Folder titles appearing in the contents list below are those provided by the dealer. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases.

bioghist.head: Francis William Bourdillon (1852-1921)
bioghist.p: Francis William Bourdillon was born in Buddington, Sussex and educated at Worcester College, Oxford. He served as tutor to the sons of Prince Christian of Schleswig-Holstein at Cumberland Lodge for several years. He later tutored for the University of Eastbourne, and settled in Eastbourne, Sussex.

Bourdillon published thirteen collections of poetry between 1874 and 1921, as well as single poems and narrative verses, many of them privately printed in limited editions. He is best-known today for the short poem "Light" ('The night has a thousand eyes.") Among his other publications were scholarly editions and translations of Old French literature; his translation of Aucassin et Nicolette appeared in 1887 and was a popular success.
In addition, Bourdillion was a member of the Alpine Club and campaigned for the preservation of the Alps against excessive development. He died in Eastbourne in 1921.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists almost entirely of printed copies of works by Francis William Bourdillon, especially his poems and occasional verse, along with several versions of his translation of Aucassin et Nicolette . In addition, there are sketchbooks, etchings, and a photograph album containing views of the Swiss Alps.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into four series: I. Verse and Other Publications, 1874-1921. II. Aucassin et Nicolette and Related French Romance Publications, 1880-1917. III. Other Papers, 1882-1917. IV. Oversize Material, 1880-1919.

controlaccess.title: Aucassin et Nicolette -- Translations
controlaccess.subject: Authors, English -- 19th century
English poetry -- 19th century
English poetry -- 20th Century
French poetry -- To 1500 -- Translations into English
Occasional verse, English

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into two subseries: Verse and Other Publications . Verse is chronologically arranged, and Other Publications is in no particular order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series I contains copies of poems by Bourdillon, chronologically arranged by date of publication, and other publications. Many of these items were privately printed or very limited editions.

Notes below some folder titles are references to A Bookman's Catalogue : The Norman Colbeck Collection of Nineteenth-Century and Edwardian Poetry and Belles Lettres in the Special Collections of the University of British Columbia .Vancouver : University of British Columbia Press, 1987. Additional bibliographic information on many items can be found in the dealer list, Box 1, folder 1.

did.unittitle: Aucassin et Nicolette and Related French Romance Publications

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Versions of Aucassin & Nicolette , chronologically arranged, are followed by chronologically arranged works related to other French romances.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series contains several editions of Bourdillon's popular translation of Aucassin & Nicolette , as well as printed items connected with his work on other French romances.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series contains three sketchbooks, seven etchings, and several folders of printed material related to Bourdillon.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series consists of several oversize printed items and an album containing photographs of landscapes in the Swiss Alps and of several mansions in Sussex.
